intro: Chaenorhinum crassifolium var. glareosum, commonly known as the glabrous chaenorhinum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated by gardeners interested in native flora.
